pages.text: The names given to actions by the ancients were certainly peculiar, but I think I'm finding some common threads.$(br2)There seem to be classes of actions with common names, named for the number of iotas they push and pop.

$(li)A $(thing)Reflection/$ pops no arguments and pushes some number.$(li)A $(thing)Purification/$ pops one and pushes one.$(li)A $(thing)Distillation/$ pops two and pushes one.$(li)An $(thing)Exaltation/$ pops three or more and pushes one.$(li)A $(thing)Decomposition/$ pops one argument and pushes two.$(li)A $(thing)Disintegration/$ pops one and pushes three or more.$(li)Finally, a $(thing)Gambit/$ pushes or pops some other number.
Spells seem to be exempt from this nomenclature and are more or less named after what they do.
